name: BBCWorld

name: BBCWorld
text:
The death of unarmed African American George Floyd in Minnesota, US has sparked demonstrations and protests across the US and around the world

So, how did we get here?

[Thread] 

https://t.co/uvhV61UDWI

name: BBCWorld
text:
25 May

George Floyd arrested by police in Minneapolis, Minnesota 

Footage shows a white officer, Derek Chauvin, kneeling on Mr Floyd‚Äôs neck for several minutes, despite him saying "I can‚Äôt breathe"

He was pronounced dead in hospital

https://t.co/uvhV61UDWI https://t.co/R9lm76qeEH

name: BBCWorld
text:
26 May

Four officers involved in the arrest, including Mr Chauvin, are fired, as video of the incident spreads on social media

Hundreds of demonstrators take to the streets of Minneapolis and vandalise police cars and the police station with graffiti

https://t.co/uvhV61UDWI https://t.co/H6ahDk7SmR

name: BBCWorld
text:
Protests spread to other cities including Memphis, Portland and Los Angeles

In some, protesters lie in the road, chanting "I can‚Äôt breathe"

Demonstrators in Minneapolis set fire to the police station where Mr Floyd was held as police retreat 

https://t.co/uvhV61UDWI https://t.co/sfuRxTECJQ

name: BBCWorld
text:
28 May 

President Trump uses Twitter to cite a lack of leadership in Minnesota and threatens to send in the National Guard

A second post is hidden by Twitter for "glorifying violence"

https://t.co/uvhV61UDWI https://t.co/vSSZJVglYB

name: BBCWorld
text:
29 May 

A CNN reporter, Omar Jimenez, is arrested live on air, alongside his colleagues, while covering the ongoing Minneapolis protests

The crew are later released from custody after confirming their credentials and the state governor apologises
https://t.co/uvhV61UDWI https://t.co/9l3nZxrIdT

name: BBCWorld
text:
29 May 

Former Minneapolis police officer Mr Chauvin, 44, is charged with third-degree murder and manslaughter over the death of Mr Floyd 

The charges carry a combined maximum 35-year sentence

https://t.co/uvhV61UDWI https://t.co/eXDjYm3Sv8

name: BBCWorld
text:
31 May

Violence spreads across the US on the sixth night of protests

üìå Five people are reported killed in nationwide protests across more than 75 cities 
üìå 4,400 people arrested  

Curfews are imposed across the US to try to stem the unrest

https://t.co/zbkuNIArFV https://t.co/RZUDGuq8bY

name: BBCWorld
text:
1 June 

President Trump threatens a military response in a national address 

He says if cities and states fail to control the protests and "defend their residents" he will deploy the army and "quickly solve the problem for them" 

https://t.co/zbkuNIS2xt https://t.co/JnbEIIaG2r

name: BBCWorld
text:
1 June 

Police use tear gas to disperse protesters as Mr Trump walks to St John‚Äôs Episcopal Church, near the White House

He poses for a photo in front of the building while holding a copy of the Bible

https://t.co/zbkuNIArFV https://t.co/ivQTep2Clg

name: BBCWorld
text:
New charges have been announced against all of the sacked police officers present at the death of George Floyd

The charge against Derek Chauvin is now second-degree murder, while the other three officers present face counts of aiding and abetting murder

https://t.co/zbkuNIArFV https://t.co/HmpNtMSJ24
